courses.description: Introduction to the design and analysis of algorithms. Covers topics such as sorting, searching, dynamic programming, and graph algorithms.
Introduction to the principles of operating systems, including processes, synchronization, scheduling, file systems, and memory management.
Introduction to programming in C/C++. Covers memory management, pointers, and basic software development.
Covers advanced data structures and algorithm analysis techniques.
Introduction to information retrieval techniques, including indexing, ranking, and search engine technologies.
Introduction to Boolean algebra and symbolic logic. Applications in computer science and problem-solving.
Covers the basics of programming using Python. Topics include control structures, functions, and data structures.
Builds upon programming concepts introduced in ICS 31. Focuses on object-oriented programming, recursion, and data structures.
Advanced programming topics, including data structures, algorithm analysis, and software engineering principles.
Introduction to programming in C/C++. Covers memory management, pointers, and basic software development.
Covers the design, implementation, and analysis of fundamental data structures, including stacks, queues, and trees.
